hypothesis: Tony Bill worked with an actor.
premise: + Tony Bill + As an actor , Bill has had supporting roles in films including Come Blow Your Horn ( 1963 ) , Shampoo ( 1975 ) , Pee-Wee 's Big Adventure ( 1985 ) , and Less Than Zero ( 1987 ) . + Tony Bill + He produced the 1973 movie The Sting , for which he shared the Academy Award for Best Picture with Michael Phillips and Julia Phillips . + Tony Bill + He made his directorial debut with My Bodyguard ( 1980 ) , and has since directed movies like Six Weeks ( 1982 ) , Five Corners ( 1987 ) , Crazy People ( 1990 ) , and Flyboys ( 2006 ) . + My Bodyguard + The film stars Chris Makepeace , Adam Baldwin , Matt Dillon , Martin Mull , and Ruth Gordon . + Dudley Moore + Dudley Stuart John Moore , CBE (  19 April 193527 March 2002 ) was an English actor , comedian , musician and composer .
explanation_1: Tony Bill worked with Dudley Moore.

hypothesis: Canada is a place in the continent of North America.
premise: + Canada + Canada  is a country in the northern part of North America .
explanation_1: Canada is a country in the northern part of North America.

hypothesis: Gwen Stefani's band released an album in 1995.
premise: + Gwen Stefani + She is the co-founder and lead vocalist of the band No Doubt that experienced major success after their breakthrough studio album Tragic Kingdom ( 1995 ) along with various successful singles , including `` Just a Girl '' , `` Do n't Speak '' , `` Hey Baby '' , and `` It 's My Life '' . + Tragic Kingdom + It was released on October 10 , 1995 by Trauma Records , a division of Interscope Records . + Just a Girl + The song was released in 1995 and helped the band break into mainstream music , peaking at number 23 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 .
explanation_1: Gwen Stefani's band released an album in 1995, however it does not say whether it was successful.

hypothesis: Helen Hunt acts in films.
premise: + Helen Hunt + She starred in the sitcom Mad About You for seven years , and played single mother Carol Connelly in the 1997 romantic comedy film As Good as It Gets , for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress . + As Good as It Gets + As Good as It Gets is a 1997 American romantic comedy film directed by James L. Brooks . + Helen Hunt + Some of her other notable films include Twister ( 1996 ) , Cast Away ( 2000 ) , What Women Want ( 2000 ) , Pay It Forward ( 2000 ) , and The Sessions ( 2012 ) , the latter garnered her a second Academy Award nomination . + Helen Hunt + Helen Elizabeth Hunt ( born June 15 , 1963 ) is an American actress , director , and screenwriter . + Cast Away + Cast Away is a 2000 American epic survival drama film directed and produced by Robert Zemeckis and starring Tom Hanks , Helen Hunt , and Nick Searcy .
explanation_1: Helen Hunt acts in films, but it does not say whether she acts in films.

hypothesis: Theodore Roosevelt thought about running for president in 1920.
premise: + Theodore Roosevelt + Though he had considered running for president again in 1920 , Roosevelt 's health continued to deteriorate , and he died in 1919 .
explanation_1: Theodore Roosevelt died in 1919.

hypothesis: India is a South Asian country.
premise: + India + India , officially the Republic of India ( Bhārat Gaṇarājya '' ) , is a country in South Asia . + South Asia + South Asia or Southern Asia is a term used to represent the southern region of the Asian continent , which comprises the sub-Himalayan SAARC countries and , for some authorities , adjoining countries to the west and east .
explanation_1: India is a country in South Asia.

hypothesis: Superman was a movie.
premise: + Superman (1978 film) + Superman ( informally titled Superman : The Movie in some listings and reference sources ) is a 1978 superhero film directed by Richard Donner and based on the DC Comics character of the same name . + Superman II + Superman II is a 1980 British-American superhero film directed by Richard Lester , based on the DC Comics character Superman . + Action Comics + Action Comics is an American comic book series that introduced Superman , one of the first major superhero characters as the term is popularly defined . + Richard Donner + After directing the horror film The Omen ( 1976 ) , Donner became famous for directing the first modern superhero film , Superman ( 1978 ) , starring Christopher Reeve . + Superman (1978 film) + The most expensive film made up to that point with a budget of $ 55 million , Superman was released in December 1978 to critical acclaim and financial success , earning $ 300 million during its original theatrical run .
explanation_1: Superman was a 1978 superhero film directed by Richard Donner.

hypothesis: John Lennon is a singer, song-writer, and vocalist.
premise: + John Lennon + John Winston Ono Lennon , ( born John Winston Lennon ; 9 October 19408 December 1980 ) was an English guitarist , singer , and songwriter who co-founded the Beatles , the most commercially successful and musically influential band in the history of popular music .
explanation_1: John Lennon is a singer, song-writer, and vocalist.

hypothesis: Jonathan Hensleigh directed a film starring John Travolta.
premise: + The Punisher (2004 film) + The Punisher is a 2004 American vigilante action film based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name , starring Thomas Jane as the antihero Frank Castle/The Punisher and John Travolta as Howard Saint , a money launderer who orders the death of Castle 's entire family . + Jonathan Hensleigh + Jonathan Blair Hensleigh ( born February 1959 ) is an American screenwriter and film director , working primarily in the action-adventure genre , best known for writing film such as Jumanji , Die Hard with a Vengeance , and Armageddon , as well as making his own directorial debut with the 2004 comic book action film The Punisher . + Die Hard with a Vengeance + It was co-produced and directed by John McTiernan ( who directed Die Hard ) , written by Jonathan Hensleigh , and stars Bruce Willis as New York City Police Department Lieutenant John McClane , Samuel L. Jackson as McClane 's reluctant partner Zeus Carver , and Jeremy Irons as Simon Peter Gruber . + Swordfish (film) + Swordfish is a 2001 American action crime thriller film directed by Dominic Sena and starring John Travolta , Hugh Jackman , Halle Berry , Don Cheadle and Vinnie Jones . + Wild Hogs + Wild Hogs '' ' is a 2007 American biker comedy road film directed by Walt Becker and starring Tim Allen , John Travolta , Martin Lawrence and William H. Macy .
explanation_1: Jonathan Hensleigh directed the film The Punisher, which starred John Travolta.

hypothesis: Iraq's capitol is its largest city.

explanation_1: Iraq's capital is Baghdad, however it does not say whether Baghdad is its largest city.

hypothesis: Justin Timberlake is an American Idol.
premise: + Justin Timberlake + Justin Randall Timberlake ( born January 31 , 1981 ) is an American singer-songwriter , actor and record producer .
explanation_1: Justin Timberlake is an American singer-songwriter, actor and record producer. He has won six Grammy Awards as well as four Emmy Awards . He is one of the most successful musicians of the decade.

hypothesis: Anna Paquin acted in a romantic drama film.
premise: + Anna Paquin + As a child , she beat 5000 candidates for the role of Flora McGrath in Jane Campion 's romantic drama film The Piano ( 1993 ) , despite having had little to no acting experience prior to getting the role . + Anna Paquin + Paquin went on to become a successful child actress , receiving multiple Young Artist Award nominations for her roles in Fly Away Home ( 1996 ) , The Member of the Wedding ( 1997 ) , and A Walk on the Moon ( 1999 ) , and was nominated for a Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture for appearing in Cameron Crowe 's comedy-drama film Almost Famous ( 2000 ) . + Romance film + Romance films or romance movies are romantic love stories recorded in visual media for broadcast in theaters and on TV that focus on passion , emotion , and the affectionate romantic involvement of the main characters and the journey that their genuinely strong , true and pure romantic love takes them through dating , courtship or marriage .
explanation_1: Anna Paquin acted in The Piano ( 1993 ) , a romance film.

hypothesis: Snoop Dogg has sold 35 million albums worldwide in 2016 alone.
premise: + Snoop Dogg + He has since sold over twenty-three million albums in the United States and thirty-five million albums worldwide .
explanation_1: Snoop Dogg has sold 35 million albums worldwide in 2016.

hypothesis: Afghanistan is in the Eastern Hemisphere.
premise: + Afghanistan + Afghanistan (  Pashto/Dari : , Afġānistān ) , officially the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan , is a landlocked country located within South Asia and Central Asia . + South Asia + South Asia or Southern Asia is a term used to represent the southern region of the Asian continent , which comprises the sub-Himalayan SAARC countries and , for some authorities , adjoining countries to the west and east .
explanation_1: Afghanistan is in the Southern Hemisphere.

hypothesis: Marta Kauffman is a poet.

hypothesis: Leonardo da Vinci didn't publish his scientific findings until he was on his deathbed.
premise: + Leonardo da Vinci + He made substantial discoveries in anatomy , civil engineering , geology , optics , and hydrodynamics , but he did not publish his findings and they had no direct influence on later science .
explanation_1: "The relevant information about the claim is lacking in the context."

hypothesis: Natalie Portman has only directed television.
premise: + A Tale of Love and Darkness (film) + A Tale of Love and Darkness is a 2015 drama film directed by Natalie Portman , based on the autobiographical novel of the same name by Israeli author Amos Oz . + Thor (film) + The film was directed by Kenneth Branagh , written by Ashley Edward Miller & Zack Stentz and Don Payne , and stars Chris Hemsworth , Natalie Portman , Tom Hiddleston , Stellan Skarsgård , Colm Feore , Ray Stevenson , Idris Elba , Kat Dennings , Rene Russo and Anthony Hopkins . + Closer (2004 film) + The movie was produced and directed by Mike Nichols and stars Julia Roberts , Jude Law , Natalie Portman and Clive Owen . + The Other Boleyn Girl (2008 film) + The Other Boleyn Girl is a 2008 historical drama film directed by Justin Chadwick . + Natalie Portman + Her first feature film as a director , A Tale of Love and Darkness , was released in 2015 .
explanation_1: Natalie Portman has directed a feature film, A Tale of Love and Darkness, and has directed television.

explanation_1: John Adams is capable of acquiring government loans from Amsterdam bankers.

hypothesis: Facebook is a social networking device.
premise: + Facebook + Facebook is an American for-profit corporation and an online social media and social networking service based in Menlo Park , California . + Facebook + As of April 2016 , Facebook was the most popular social networking site in the world , based on the number of active user accounts .

hypothesis: Leonardo DiCaprio is a director.
premise: + The Man in the Iron Mask (1998 film) + The Man in the Iron Mask is a 1998 American action drama film directed , produced , and written by Randall Wallace , and starring Leonardo DiCaprio in a dual role as the title character and villain , Jeremy Irons as Aramis , John Malkovich as Athos , Gerard Depardieu as Porthos , and Gabriel Byrne as D'Artagnan . + Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio + Film director Martin Scorsese and actor Leonardo DiCaprio have frequently collaborated , making a total of five feature films and one short film since 2002 . + Catch Me If You Can + The film was directed by Steven Spielberg and stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks , with Christopher Walken , Martin Sheen , and Nathalie Baye in supporting roles . + Leonardo DiCaprio + DiCaprio 's subsequent films include The Man in the Iron Mask ( 1998 ) , the biographical crime drama Catch Me If You Can ( 2002 ) , and the epic historical drama Gangs of New York ( 2002 ) , which marked his first of many collaborations with director Martin Scorsese . + Gangs of New York + Gangs of New York is a 2002 American epic period drama film directed by Martin Scorsese , set in the mid-19th century in the Five Points district of New York City .
explanation_1: Leonardo DiCaprio has directed two films, The Man in the Iron Mask ( 1998 ) and Catch Me If You Can ( 2002 ) .

hypothesis: Kaitlin Olson, American actress, started her career in the television show called Groundlings.
premise: + Kaitlin Olson + She began her career in the Groundlings , an improvisational group in Los Angeles , California , and had minor roles in several television series before being cast as Deandra `` Sweet Dee '' Reynolds on the FX black comedy series It 's Always Sunny in Philadelphia in 2005 . + Kaitlin Olson + Kaitlin Willow Olson ( born August 18 , 1975 ) is an American actress and comedian .
explanation_1: Kaitlin Olson is an American actress and comedian. She began her career in the Groundlings, an improvisational group in Los Angeles, California.

hypothesis: FC Barcelona is a North American football club.
premise: + FC Barcelona + Futbol Club Barcelona  , commonly known as Barcelona and familiarly as Barça , is a professional football club based in Barcelona , Catalonia , Spain . + Real Madrid C.F. + Real Madrid Club de Fútbol (  Royal Madrid Football Club ) , commonly known as Real Madrid , or simply as Real , is a professional football club based in Madrid , Spain . + El Clásico + El Clásico (  El Clàssic ,  `` The Classic '' ) is the name given in football to any match between fierce rivals Real Madrid and FC Barcelona . + FC Barcelona + In international club football , Barcelona has won twenty European and World titles - four UEFA Champions League titles and one European Cup , a record four UEFA Cup Winners ' Cup , a shared record five UEFA Super Cup , a record three Inter-Cities Fairs Cup and a record three FIFA Club World Cup . + FC Barcelona + In 2009 , Barcelona became the first Spanish club to win the continental treble consisting of La Liga , Copa del Rey , and the UEFA Champions League , and also became the first football club to win six out of six competitions in a single year , completing the sextuple in also winning the Spanish Super Cup , UEFA Super Cup and FIFA Club World Cup .
explanation_1: FC Barcelona is a football club from Spain.

hypothesis: Coldplay's debut album was modeled after a Mercury Prize.
premise: + Mercury Prize + The Mercury Prize , formerly called the Mercury Music Prize , is an annual music prize awarded for the best album from the United Kingdom and Ireland . + Coldplay + Coldplay achieved worldwide fame with the release of the single `` Yellow '' in 2000 , followed in the same year by their debut album Parachutes , which was nominated for the Mercury Prize . + Parachutes (album) + Parachutes is the debut studio album by British rock band Coldplay .
explanation_1: Coldplay's debut album was nominated for the Mercury Prize.
